result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin P Cherry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay $250.00 fine plus costs.   If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin P Cherry

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kevin P Cherry in court with attorney Francis P Raff.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Defendant Kevin P Cherry in court with attorney Julia Marie May.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Bond remains. Minutes Filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Defendant appears in court. ADA Andrew Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

MUST POST $500.00 CASH.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.    Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH ALPINE VALLEY RESORT AND MUSIC THEATRE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
